result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy Michael Collier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Exposing genitals to a child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  Defendant has 1 day credit if probation revoked.
Defendant may apply for expungment if law abiding & fine paid in full within 36 mos.. Upon successful completion of probation, record may be expunged, 973.015.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy Michael Collier

Defendant Jeremy Michael Collier in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Defendant Jeremy Michael Collier in custody.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amend to 948.10(1)(a).    No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.

Defendant Jeremy Michael Collier appeared by video means with Attorney Steinman. Prosecuting Atty Sue M. Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does qualify.  State request cash bond.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Attorney Steinman gives status.  Lives locally, no warrant history.    Time limits waived. $7,000.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact with G.J.S. or any females under the age of 18 years (unless in the presence of a responsible, 3rd party adult)  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 25, 2014 at 09:45 am.
